text: The 60th Street Branch of the Pennsylvania Railroad was a branch line from South 58th Street in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, to Hog Island, Pennsylvania. It was built in 1918 by the Philadelphia, Baltimore and Washington Railroad, a subsidiary of the PRR, and opened for service on August 20 of that year. The line diverged from the PW&B;'s main line just north of Brill Interlocking, and bore southeast before curving southwest again. ==Notes== Category:Philadelphia, Baltimore and Washington Railroad lines Category:Pennsylvania Railroad lines
title: 60th Street Branch
